column13: food was great service and your servers a plus to your business they were very friendly and fun I would recommend to others
The food, service, servers were all outstanding! Best place iv eaten in a very long time! Definetly going back!

We were very pleased with the fresh fish. Excellent flavor and quality. My only complaint was were sitting in a corner enjoying a romantic evening and the hostess seated a birthday party of 4 ladies right behind us that we're loud even though many other sections were completely empty. Would have preferred to avoid that.

My girlfriend and I went there for our second year anniversary,the waitress congragulated us on it. And wished us many more,the staff was great n so was the feel of the place.defiantly a good spot for romantic dates or even just a night out

Every time we've eaten here, we've always had great experience/service. We love the calamari, but we've noticed lately that the amount of calamari on the plate has diminished. We have to order 2 now. Overall, Outstanding Service!

We had the calamari piccata appetizer and both chose the Filet Wellington (perfectly medium rare) for our entrées. For dessert we had the Danish berry pudding, finished tableside with rich cream. Everything was delicious! The servers were friendly and attentive and I loved the atmosphere. Definitely a special occasion restaurant for us!
Food was wonderful, as always. Still our favorite foodie destination in Anchorage.

Late evening dinner, last to leave but not the slightest hint that we were keeping thestaff from other things. Food and wine were excellent. Service was the best of Alaskan, friendly, on time and very helpful.

column4: 3211 Providence Drive Cuddy Hall Anchorage, AK  99508
column13: Lucy's is a fine dining restaurant that supports the UAA Culinary program. Since the food is cooked by students there is a potential for the food to be "hit or miss", though I have experienced more hits than misses.I think it is a wonderful thing they are doing for the students and recommend that all my friends go check it out at least twice.
Top notch gourmet food in a comfortable, homey setting. Like going for dinner at your aunt's house, and your aunt is a 5 star chef.

We were truly amazed. What a great find. I had the pork belly and my husband had a New York strip with foie gras. In Anchorage! So good, great wine selection and the service was amazing. Friendly without being intrusive. Just a wonderful dinner.
Food was great. Kitchen and bar were slow. It was a busy night though
Excellent brunch, much quieter than most downtown spots, very enjoyable.

Took 20 minutes to get a scratch margarita that was way too bitter. Waitress was ditzy and couldn't do more than one thing at a time. Asked for our chicken wing appetizer to be extra crispy, they looked like they were boiled. We ended up cashing out and going to another place for dinner. We won't be back!

Took my wife for her birthday and the service was absolutley awful. The worst that I have experienced in Fairbanks (and that's saying something), on five separate occasions during our meal one of the two of us was completely without a beverage (drink or water). The food was not horrible, but it certainly did not make up for the hideous customer service. You certainly expect better when paying $125.00 for your evening. Don't waste your time or money folks, go to the Silver Gulch instead.

Took my wife there before a show. Fit the evening nicely. Good food with great presentation, attentive service and a wine list a mile long. A little on the pricey side, but not overpriced by any means.
Rachel is so great. She took great care of my family. Wonderfull wine service from robert. Taylor oh wow the best hostess in the west. Thank you so much be back this winter.

I took my young daughters to eat prior to seeIng the musical "Shreck.". The staff treated them just great. They both felt like special guests. We ordered fish and chips for the girls and I had a salad so my rating of the food is more a reflection of that particular meal selection then the general quality of Simon & Seaforts food which is typically very good.
I am a vegetarian and they always have so many yummy options. It's my favorite breakfast place.

We visit this restaurant on a regular basis due to it's proximity to our home and overall quality of food and ambiance. On this evening, my spouse tried the eggplant appetizer. Portion was of good size, was very well presented and tasted great. One of my favorites for the slad lovers is the Chevre Salad. The warm fried cheese that comes with the salad makes the dish and it is a winner.

column4: 320 W. 5th Avenue Fifth Avenue Mall Room C01 Anchorage, AK  99501
column13: Wonderful staff, friendly and polite. We completly emjoyed our meal.

column4: 5121 Arctic Blvd Suite I Anchorage, AK  99503
column13: Still good food, but not as good as it used to be.
